state Package¶

class gensokyo.state.StateNode¶

enter(self, root)¶
exit(self, root)¶
class gensokyo.state.StateTree¶

Bases: gensokyo.state.TreeNode, pyglet.event.EventDispatcher

A state machine crossed with a tree.

StateTree is the root node. All children nodes are instances of StateNode, which is a subclass of StateTree that are also states. The root node StateTree itself is not a state, but it can have a state (it is a state machine). Its children are states, but can also have children states. Thus, a tree.

The state machine runs by dispatching events from the root. The current state is determined by the event handlers currently attached to the root. The tree serves as data-keeping to keep track of this state. Transitions are made by dispatching the ‘on_transition’ event to the root. The event should be send with a Transition named tuple.

Transition tuples have two fields: a class object to of the state to transition to, and a boolean save indicating whether the current state should be left or “saved” on the tree. The transition will traverse upward from the current leaf until a node is found that can have the indicated state. If an instance of the state is still in the tree (“saved”), then it will be restored. Otherwise, a new instance of the class will be made, added to the tree, and activated.
